Key Arguments: The legislation represents government censorship and infringes on free speech.
Individuals should have the freedom to discuss and resolve issues, even with those who may misinform.
Censorship is not the government's responsibility and poses a greater threat than the misinformation itself.
Labeling speech as misinformation is seen as Orwellian and could lead to tyranny.
The government should not decide what constitutes misinformation; individuals should make that determination.
Notable Quotes: Censorship or cancelling people's voices due to your opinion of 'misinformation or disinformation' IS NOT the answer!
Censoring ideas & speech by labelling it misinformation or disinformation is an Evil & Orwellian notion.
What I NEED MY GOVERNMENT TO DO IS.........Just tell me what 'WAS' said and I’ll decide what’s misinformation.
